data.definition: a traditional story sometimes popularly regarded as historical but not authenticated, an extremely famous or notorious person, especially in a particular field
data.sentence: Azam Khan is a music legend of Bangladesh.

data.definition: take aggressive military action against (a place or enemy forces ) with weapons or armed force
data.sentence: In February the Germans attacked Verdun

data.definition: absolutely necessary; extremely important
data.sentence: It is essential to keep up-to-date records.

data.definition: lung inflammation caused by bacterial or viral infection, in which the air sacs fill with pus and may become solid.
data.sentence: The patient is suffering from Pneumonia

data.definition: a large thick-skinned semiaquatic African mammal, with massive jaws and large tusks
data.sentence: Dhaka zoo has few Hippopotamuses

data.definition: Be in or assume a position in which the body is supported by a knee or the knees, as when praying or showing submission
data.sentence: They kneel down and pray to God

data.definition: extremely comfortable or elegant, especially when involving great expense, giving self-indulgent or sensual pleasure
data.sentence: Cox's Bazar's most luxurious hotel is Long beach Hotel.

data.definition: a deputy or substitute acting for a superior: a rank of officer in the British army, above second lieutenant and below captain. a rank of officer in the navy, above sub lieutenant and below lieutenant commander
data.sentence: He is working as one of the Prime Minister's most trusted lieutenants.

data.definition: An indiscriminate and brutal slaughter of many people, deliberately and brutally kill (many people).
data.sentence: Reports of massacres on 15th August 1975 not only moved the people of Bangladesh but also the people all over the world.

data.definition: a feeling of deep sadness; melancholy
data.sentence: The haunting melancholia dominates the album.

data.definition: a medicinal drug taken to reduce tension or anxiety
data.sentence: We used tranquillizer to control the animals

data.definition: careful and persistent work or effort
data.sentence: His diligence is well known.

data.definition: a situation in which a difficult choice has to be made between two or more alternatives, especially ones that are equally undesirable
data.sentence: When there is a question of shopping, girls are always in dilemma.

data.definition: continuing without pause or interruption
data.sentence: The incessant beat of music which is coming from the next room, hampering the concentration of the reader.

data.definition: not clear or decided
data.sentence: The election result was ambiguous.

data.definition: a pause or break
data.sentence: He was granted an intermission in his studies.

data.definition: a substance that increases the rate of a chemical reaction without itself undergoing any permanent chemical change. a person or thing that precipitates an event
data.sentence: The prime minister's speech acted as a catalyst for debate.

data.definition: put (someone or something) into a situation in which there is a danger of loss, harm, or failure
data.sentence: A devaluation of the dollar would jeopardize New York's position as a financial center.

data.definition: a group of people appointed for a specific function by a larger group and typically consisting of members of that group
data.sentence: The housing committee took a decision of making Mr. Anwar to be their president.

data.definition: a large African mammal with a very long neck and forelegs, having a coat patterned with brown patches separated by lighter lines . It is the tallest living animal.
data.sentence: We went to the zoo and saw a giraffe.

data.definition: a long-term mental disorder of a type involving a breakdown in the relation between thought, emotion, and behaviour, leading to faulty perception, inappropriate actions and feelings, withdrawal from reality and personal relationships into fantasy and delu
data.sentence: She suffers from schizophrenia

data.definition: the art of making two-or three-dimensional representative or abstract forms , especially by carving stone or wood or by casting metal or plaster
data.sentence: David is a beautiful sculpture by Michael Angelo.

data.definition: the scientific study of the human mind and its functions, especially those affecting behaviour in a given context. the mental characteristics or attitude of a person or group
data.sentence: A mother can understand her child's psychology very well.

data.definition: a person living next door to or very near to the speaker or person referred to
data.sentence: Our garden was the envy of the neighbors.

data.definition: plentiful, existing or available in large quantities, having plenty of
data.sentence: There are abundant natural gas in Bangladesh.

data.definition: total,complete, complete, utter, unconditional, despotic, not relative or comparative
data.sentence: The absolute silence made us listen to the speech.

data.definition: the resentful or unhappy feeling of wanting somebody else's success, good fortune, qualities, or possessions/ to desire something possessed by somebody else
data.sentence: I envy you for your success.

data.definition: inclusion, absorbing or being absorbed, mental engrossment
data.sentence: The civilians suffered absorption during the war.

data.definition: mishap, an unpleasant event, especially in a vehicle, that happens unexpectedly and causes injury or damage, chance , coincidence, something that happens unexpectedly and is not planned in advance
data.sentence: He was killed in a road accident.

data.definition: accomplishment, a thing that somebody has done successfully, especially using their own effort and skill
data.sentence: It was a remarkable achievement for such a young player.

data.definition: housing, a place to live, work or stay, in an agreement or arrangement between people or groups with different opinions
data.sentence: Hotel accommodation is included in the price of your holiday.

data.definition: blame to say that somebody has done something wrong or is guilty of something, an agreement or arrangement between people or groups with different opinions which is acceptable to everyone
data.sentence: The government was accused of incompetence.

data.definition: recognize, to accept that something is true, to accept that somebody/something has a particular authority or status, acknowledge something to tell somebody that you have received something that they sent to you
data.sentence: It is generally acknowledged to be true that there were more rainfall last year.

data.definition: to write on an envelope, etc. the name and address of the person, company, etc. that you are sending it to by mail, to make a formal speech to a group of people
data.sentence: The address on the letter was correct, but it was delivered to the wrong house.

data.definition: sufficientenough in quantity, or good enough in quality, for a particular purpose or need
data.sentence: The room was small but adequate.

data.definition: respect,appreciationa feeling of respect and liking for somebody/something
data.sentence: I have great admiration for her as a writer.

data.definition: approve, take up, agree to, to take somebody else's child into your family and become its legal parent(s), adopt something to start to use a particular method
data.sentence: The council is expected to adopt the new policy at its next meeting.

data.definition: friend, supporter, collaboratortor, give your support to another group or country
data.sentence: The prince allied himself with the mass people.

data.definition: nervousness,worry,concernthe state of feeling nervous or worried that something bad is going to happenSentence- Waiting for exam results is a time of great anxiety.a worry or fear about somethinga strong feeling of wanting to do something or of want
data.sentence: If you're worried about your health, share your anxieties with your doctor.

data.definition: to tell someone that you are sorry for having done something that has caused them problems or unhappiness
data.sentence: We apologise for the late departure of this flight.

data.definition: meeting, a formal arrangement to meet or visit somebody at a particular time, especially for a reason connected with their work, the act of choosing a person for a job or position of responsibility; the fact of being chosen for a job
data.sentence: I've got a dental appointment at 3 o'clock.

data.definition: estimated, nearalmost correct or accurate, but not completely so
data.sentence: the cost given for the construction is only approximate.

data.definition: repugnant,detestableinspiring disgust and loathing
data.sentence: racism was abhorrent to us all

data.definition: Which has happened before.
data.sentence: The story is antecedent ed.

data.definition: 1.series of planned activities that are intended to achieve a particular social, commercial or political aim. 2. movement
data.sentence: We ran a successful campaign against smoking in public today.

data.definition: form an idea of something in your mind.
data.sentence: These people do not conceptualise hunting as a violent act.

data.definition: 1.the system of laws and basic principles that a state, a country or an organization is governed by2. the way something is formed or organized3. foundation ,charter
data.sentence: the genetic constitution of cells is very complex.

data.definition: 1 if two statements, etc. are inconsistent, or one is inconsistent with the other, they cannot both be true because they give the facts in a different way. 2. tending to change too often; not staying the same3. incoherent
data.sentence: The report is inconsistent with the financial statements.

data.definition: not careful about what you say or do, especially when this embarrasses or offends somebody.2. careless
data.sentence: it was indiscreet of him to disclose that information.

data.definition: not big or valuable enough to be considered important.2. unimportant
data.sentence: The levels of chemicals in the river are not insignificant.

data.definition: 1 the particular way in which something is understood or explained2 the particular way in which somebody chooses to perform a piece of music, a role in a play, etc.
data.sentence: 1. Her evidence suggests a different interpretation of the events.2. a modern interpretation of â€˜King Learâ€™ is quite captive.

data.definition: a set of methods and principles used to perform a particular activity.
data.sentence: The recent changes in the methodology of language teaching is effective.

data.definition: 1 [COUNTABLE]something that happens or exists.2. incidence
data.sentence: Terrorism is a daily occurrence in Afghanistan.

data.definition: 1 [COUNTABLE, USUALLY PLURAL] proceeding (against somebody) (for something)the process of using a court to settle a disagreement or to deal with a complaint.2. happening
data.sentence: The Mayor will open the proceedings at the City Hall tomorrow.

data.definition: to think again about something to decide if you need to change your opinion of it.
data.sentence: After reassessing the situation, she decided to do nothing

data.definition: 1 the act of getting something, especially knowledge, a skill, etc.2. a company, piece of land, etc. bought by somebody, especially another company; the act of buying it3. achievement
data.sentence: The group has announced its first overseas acquisition- a successful software company.

data.definition: 1 to officially ask somebody to write, make or create something or to do a task for you.2 [USUALLY PASSIVE] to choose somebody as an officer in one of the armed forces.
data.sentence: He has just been commissioned (as a) pilot officer.

data.definition: 1.a result of something that has happened.2 importance3. result
data.sentence: This decision could have serious consequences for the industry.

data.definition: the act of using energy, food or materials; the amount used, the act of buying and using products
data.sentence: He was advised to reduce his alcohol consumption.

data.definition: to free a trade, a business activity, etc. from rules and controls.
data.sentence: Deregulated financial markets are risky factors of a inefficient government.

data.definition: to make something become part of an organized system, society or culture, so that it is considered normal.
data.sentence: Gay marriage is institutionalized in NY , USA in 2010.

data.definition: not important to or connected with a situation, immaterial
data.sentence: Many people consider politics irrelevant to their lives.

data.definition: good at finding ways of doing things and solving problems, etc., inventive
data.sentence: The women at the entrepreneur conference were strong, resourceful and courageous.

data.definition: to notice or become aware of something, to understand or think of somebody/something in a particular way, see
data.sentence: The patient was perceived to have difficulty in breathing.

data.definition: be or go beyond the range or limits of (a field of activity or conceptual sphere), go beyond
data.sentence: Th idea was transcended to mass people.

data.definition: a device that can both transmit and receive communications, in particular a combined radio transmitter and receiver, transmitter
data.sentence: Grameen phone has established a lot of transceiver's to strengthen their network.

data.definition: to force somebody to do something or behave in a particular way, to restrict or limit somebody/something, limit
data.sentence: Research has been constrained by a lack of funds.

data.definition: the letters a person sends and receives, the activity of writing letters, connection
data.sentence: The editor welcomes correspondence from readers on any subject.

data.definition: a public meeting or march at which people show that they are protesting against or supporting somebody/something, an act of showing or explaining how something works or is done, an act of giving proof or evidence for something, display
data.sentence: We were given a brief demonstration of the computer's functions.

data.definition: the act of preventing somebody/something from entering a place or taking part in something, a person or thing that is not included in something, segregation
data.sentence: He was disappointed with his exclusion from the England squad.

data.definition: statement, answer, etc. is given with force to show that it is important or making it very clear what you mean by speaking with force, forceful
data.sentence: He was emphatic that he could not work with her.

data.definition: a drawing or picture in a book, magazine, etc. especially one that explains something. a story, an event or an example that clearly shows the truth about something, picture
data.sentence: The statistics are a clear illustration of the point I am trying to make.

data.definition: unable to be explained or accounted for, strange
data.sentence: For some inexplicable reason her mind went completely blank.

data.definition: unable to be reached, unreachable
data.sentence: The city center is inaccessible to traffic in most places.

data.definition: the high standard that is expected from a person who is well trained in a particular job, great skill and ability
data.sentence: We were impressed by the professionalism of the staff,

data.definition: a person or thing equal to another in value or measure or force or effect or significance etc., equal in value, amount, meaning, importance, etc., the atomic weight of an element that has the same combining capacity as a given weight of another element
data.sentence: Eight kilometers is roughly equivalent to five miles.

data.definition: connected with evolution; connected with gradual development and change
data.sentence: Free market is an evolutionary by-product of capitalism.

data.definition: the belief in and process of increasing the size and importance of something, especially in a country or a business
data.sentence: The economic expansionism of America has created a benchmark for others.

data.definition: the money that a government receives from taxes or that an organization, etc. receives from its business, income
data.sentence: The company's annual revenues rose by 30%.

data.definition: quarrel, fight,disputea conversation or discussion in which two or more people disagree, often angrily
data.sentence: We had an argument with the waiter about the bill

data.definition: influx,comingan act of coming or being brought to a placea person or thing that comes to a place
data.sentence: We apologize for the late arrival of the train.The first arrivals at the concert got the best seats

data.definition: embarrassedfeeling shame or embarrassment about somebody/something or because of something you have done
data.sentence: She was deeply ashamed of her behaviour at the party

data.definition: organisationan official group of people who have joined together for a particular purpose
data.sentence: Do you belong to any professional or trade associations?

data.definition: environment1 the mixture of gases that surrounds the earth2 mixture of gases that surrounds another planet or a star3 the feeling or mood that you have in a particular place or situation; a feeling between two people or in a group of people.
data.sentence: The hotel offers a friendly atmosphere and personal service.

data.definition: spectators ,viewers1 the group of people who have gathered to watch or listen to something (a play, concert, somebody speaking, etc.)
data.sentence: The debate was televised in front of a live audience.

data.definition: carnivala special event that people organize in order to celebrate something
data.sentence: Her triumph was a cause for celebration

data.definition: a unit for measuring length
data.sentence: There are 100 centimetres in a metre

data.definition: ritual a public or religious occasion that includes a series of formal or traditional actions
data.sentence: Eid ul fitr is a religious ceremony for muslim.

data.definition: record an official document that may be used to prove that the facts it states are truean official document proving that you have completed a course of study or passed an exam; a qualification obtained after a course of study or an exam
data.sentence: Postgraduate Certificate in Education is the most elegant part of oneâ€™s career.

data.definition: upper limitthe top inside surface of a room
data.sentence: She lay on her back staring up at the ceiling

data.definition: featurea typical feature or quality that something/somebody has
data.sentence: The two groups of children have quite different characteristics

data.definition: a printed form that you can write on and sign as a way of paying for something instead of using money
data.sentence: I have paid my tuition fees by cheque.

data.definition: jollyhappy, and showing it by the way that you behave
data.sentence: You're not your usual cheerful self today

data.definition: a thin tube of paper filled with tobacco, for smoking
data.sentence: to light a cigarette in a windy weather is very hard

data.definition: situationthe conditions and facts that are connected with and affect a situation, an event or an action
data.sentence: The company reserves the right to cancel this agreement in certain circumstances

data.definition: modela book, film/movie or song which is well known and considered to be of very high quality, setting standards for other books, etc
data.sentence: The novel may become a modern classic.

data.definition: secreta small room or a space in a wall with a door that reaches the floor, used for storing things
data.sentence: Homosexuals in public life are now coming out of the closet

data.definition: fall downa sudden failure of something, such as an institution, a business or a course of action
data.sentence: The peace talks were on the verge of collapse

data.definition: coworkera person that you work with, especially in a profession or a business
data.sentence: We were friends and colleagues for more than 20 years

data.definition: promisea promise to do something or to behave in a particular way; a promise to support somebody/something; the fact of committing yourself
data.sentence: She doesn't want to make a big emotional commitment to Milon at the moment

data.definition: contrastthe process of comparing two or more people or things
data.sentence: Comparison with other oil-producing countries is extremely interesting

data.definition: objectiona reason for not being satisfied; a statement that somebody makes saying that they are not satisfied
data.sentence: We received a number of complaints from customers about the lack of parking facilities

data.definition: attentionthe ability to direct all your effort and attention on one thing, without thinking of other things
data.sentence: This book requires a great deal of concentration

data.definition: meetinga large official meeting, usually lasting for a few days, at which people with the same work or interests come together to discuss their views
data.sentence: She is attending a three-day conference on AIDS education

data.definition: thoughtthe act of thinking carefully about something
data.sentence: The proposals are currently under consideration

data.definition: donationa sum of money that is given to a person or an organization in order to help pay for something
data.sentence: He made a very positive contribution to the success of the project

data.definition: chatan informal talk involving a small group of people or only two; the activity of talking in this way
data.sentence: I had a long conversation with her the other day

data.definition: a plant grown in warm countries for the soft white hairs around its seeds that are used to make cloth and thread
data.sentence: The sheets are 100% pure cotton

data.definition: an act or a sound of coughing
data.sentence: She gave a little cough to attract my attention

data.definition: modela standard or principle by which something is judged, or with the help of which a decision is made
data.sentence: What criteria are used for assessing a student's ability?

data.definition: a period of ten years, especially a continuous period, such as 1910â€“1919 or 2000â€“2009
data.sentence: last decade was remarkable for USA in terms of war against terrorism

data.definition: refuseto refuse politely to accept or to do somethingto become smaller, fewer, weaker, etc
data.sentence: I offered to give them a lift but they declined

data.definition: reduce the process of reducing something or the amount that something is reduced by
data.sentence: There has been some decrease in military spending this year

data.definition: on purpose done on purpose rather than by accident done slowly and carefully
data.sentence: The speech was a deliberate attempt to embarrass the government

data.definition: pleasedvery pleased
data.sentence: I'd be absolutely delighted to come. She was delighted by/at the news of the wedding

data.definition: miserablemaking you feel very sad and without enthusiasm
data.sentence: Looking for a job these days can be very depressing.

data.definition: a person who is frightened and in need of help, arising from or marked by despair or loss of hope, desperately determined, (of persons) dangerously reckless or violent as from urgency or despair, showing extreme courage; especially of actions courageously
data.sentence: I was absolutely desperate to see her.

data.definition: going away the act of leaving a place; an example of thisa plane, train, etc. leaving a place at a particular time
data.sentence: Flights should be confirmed 48 hours before departure

data.definition: the quality that makes you continue trying to do something even when this is difficult
data.sentence: I admire her determination to get it right

data.definition: differencea situation where people have different opinions about something and often argue
data.sentence: There is disagreement among archaeologists as to the age of the sculpture

data.definition: discontentsadness because something has not happened or been as good, successful, etc. as you expected or hoped
data.sentence: He found it difficult to hide his disappointment when she didn't arrive

data.definition: the process of discussing somebody/something; a conversation about somebody/something ; conversation
data.sentence: We had a discussion with them about the differences between Britain and the US

data.definition: connected with or happening at the time of somebody's death ; falling
data.sentence: I will remember it to my dying day.

data.definition: the lower floor of a house or building, especially the one at ground level ; down the below
data.sentence: We're painting the downstairs

data.definition: next to or near something ; nearby
data.sentence: Our farm land was adjacent to the river.

data.definition: to come together as a group; to bring people or things together as a group ; to fit together all the separate parts of something, for example a piece of furniture ;come together
data.sentence: The manager has assembled a world-class team.The shelves are easy to assemble.

data.definition: a meeting, especially one that is sudden, unexpected or violent ;a sports match against a particular player or team ;meet
data.sentence: Three of them were killed in the subsequent encounter with the police.She has beaten her opponent in all of their previous encounters.

data.definition: extremely large ; huge
data.sentence: The problems facing the President are enormous.

data.definition: going to happen, be published, etc. very soon ; approaching
data.sentence: The band's forthcoming UK tour has gained huge attention.

data.definition: the quality of being honest and having strong moral principles; reliability
data.sentence: The integrity shown by the soldiers in Afghanistan is applaud able.

data.definition: the fact of continuing to try to do something despite difficulties, especially when other people are against you and think that you are being annoying or unreasonable; dilligence
data.sentence: His persistence was finally rewarded when the insurance company agreed to pay for the damage.

data.definition: easy to do or to understand; not complicated; honest and open; not trying to trick somebody or hide something;frank
data.sentence: It's quite straightforward to get here.Let me put it more straightforwardly.

data.definition: not stopping; seeming to have no end;continuous
data.sentence: His ceaseless questions began to annoy me.

data.definition: to be the most important part of something;mass
data.sentence: The issue is likely to bulk large at the next summit meeting.

data.definition: a statement that something will certainly be true or will certainly happen, particularly when there has been doubt about it ;guarantee
data.sentence: They called for assurances that the government is committed to its education policy.

data.definition: Beginning ; a ceremony at which students receive their academic degrees or diplomas;start
data.sentence: The commencement of the financial year is very crucial for any government.

data.definition: causing a lot of angry public discussion and disagreement ; notorious
data.sentence: Winston Churchill and Richard Nixon were both controversial figures.

data.definition: to become or to make something become smaller, weaker, etc ;reduce
data.sentence: The world's resources are rapidly diminishing.

data.definition: showing a clear understanding of a person or situation ;perceptive
data.sentence: Mr. hashem is an insightful historian.

data.definition: a preliminary is an action or event that is done in preparation for something ;first round
data.sentence: Research will be needed as a preliminary to taking a decision.

data.definition: the act of officially removing somebody from their job, school, team, etc. for a period of time, usually as a punishment ;the system by which a vehicle is supported on its wheels and which makes it more comfortable to ride in when the road surface is not
data.sentence: The two players are appealing against their suspensions.The extra ordinary part of Ferrari is the front/rear suspension engineering

data.definition: that you have not expected or predicted; that you have not anticipated;surprising
data.sentence: The unanticipated call from my close friend has been a great delight.

data.definition: a small change to something that improves it;a thing that is an improvement on an earlier, similar thing;improvement
data.sentence: This particular model has a further refinement.

data.definition: a description of how things might happen in the future;picture
data.sentence: Let me suggest a possible scenario of this game.

data.definition: shaped like a sphere.
data.sentence: Lens is spherical.

data.definition: the state of having more than one possible meaning;a word or statement that can be understood in more than one way;doubt
data.sentence: Write clear definitions in order to avoid ambiguity.There were several inconsistencies and ambiguities in her speech.

data.definition: a situation in which somebody treats somebody else in an unfair way, especially in order to make money from their work;the fact of using a situation in order to get an advantage for yourself;utilization
data.sentence: Starvation and poverty are the result of global economic exploitation, not lack of resources.Exploitation of the situation for his own purposes is a wrong doing.

data.definition: to change frequently in size, amount, quality, etc, especially from one extreme to another;vary
data.sentence: During the crisis, oil prices fluctuated between $20 and $40 a barrel.

data.definition: the basic systems and services that are necessary for a country or an organization to run smoothly, for example buildings, transport and water and power supplies.
data.sentence: Development of infrastructure is a must for progress in industrialization.

data.definition: the state or quality of being intense;strength;acute;severe.
data.sentence: The storm resumed with even greater intensity.

data.definition: a person who works in a profession, especially medicine or law, person who regularly does a particular activity, especially one that requires skill
data.sentence: One of the greatest practitioners of science fiction is Dr. Muhamamd zafar iqbal.

data.definition: the situation of being greater in number or amount than other things or people;majority.
data.sentence: A predominance of female teachers in elementary schools is a positive sign.

data.definition: expected to do something or to become something;potential
data.sentence: They are worried about prospective changes in the law.

data.definition: extra soldiers or police officers who are sent to a place because more are needed, the act of making something stronger, especially a feeling or an idea.
data.sentence: The reinforcement in Iraq is evident.

data.definition: to change the time at which something has been arranged to happen, especially so that it takes place later ;rearrange
data.sentence: The meeting has been rescheduled for next week.

data.definition: the act of ending something; the end of something ;extinction
data.sentence: Failure to comply with these conditions will result in termination of the contract.

data.definition: the world; the planet that we live on ;land; the hard surface of the world that is not the sea or the sky; the ground, the substance that plants grow in ; ground
data.sentence: The earth revolves around the sun.I cleaned off the earth clinging to my boots.

data.definition: the form in which a book is published ; a particular newspaper or magazine, or radio or television programme, especially one in a regular series ; the total number of copies of a book, newspaper or magazine, etc. published at one time ; version
data.sentence: She collects first editions of Victorian novels.The dictionary is now in its eighth edition.The story was in Tuesday's edition of â€˜The New York Timesâ€™.

data.definition: doing something well and thoroughly with no waste of time, money, or energy ;capable
data.sentence: He is an efficient secretary.

data.definition: a form of energy from charged elementary particles, usually supplied as electric current through cables, wires, etc. for lighting, heating, driving machines, etc .
data.sentence: The electricity is off so there is no electric power supply.

data.definition: attractive and showing a good sense of style.
data.sentence: She was tall and elegant.

data.definition: a necessary or typical part of something, a small amount of a quality or feeling ,the basic principles of a subject that you have to learn first
data.sentence: Cost was a key element in our decision.We need to preserve the element of surprise.He taught me the elements of map-reading.

data.definition: a machine that carries people or goods up and down to different levels in a building or a mine.
data.sentence: It's on the fifth floor, so we'd better take the elevator.

data.definition: shy, awkward or guilty feelings; a feeling of being embarrassed;a person who causes problems for another person or other people and makes them feel embarrassed ; shame
data.sentence: I'm glad you offered, it saved me the embarrassment of having to ask.

data.definition: a sudden serious and dangerous event or situation which needs immediate action to deal with it ; crisis
data.sentence: The government has declared a state of emergency following the earthquake.I always have some extra cash with me for emergencies.

data.definition: to give special importance to something
data.sentence: His speech emphasized the importance of attracting industry to the town. The rising tone of his voice emphasized his panic.

data.definition: a person who is paid to work for somebody ; worker
data.sentence: The firm has over 500 employees.

data.definition: the act of encouraging somebody to do something; something that encourages somebody ; support
data.sentence: With a little encouragement from his parents he should do well.

data.definition: a person whose job involves designing and building engines, machines, roads, bridges, etc. ; a person who is trained to repair machines and electrical equipment ; technician
data.sentence: They're sending an engineer to fix the transmitter.

data.definition: to invite people to eat or drink with you as your guests, especially in your home ; to interest and amuse somebody in order to please them ; amuse
data.sentence: Barbecues are a favourite way of entertaining friends.He entertained us for hours with his stories and jokes.

data.definition: a strong feeling of excitement and interest in something and a desire to become involved in it ; interest
data.sentence: She never lost her enthusiasm for teaching. Reading is one of her many enthusiasms.

data.definition: the conditions that affect the behaviour and development of somebody/something; the physical conditions that somebody/something exists in ; the natural world in which people, animals and plants live ; surrounding
data.sentence: They have created an environment in which productivity should flourish.

data.definition: the things that are needed for a particular purpose or activity ; gear
data.sentence: The equipment of the photographic studio was expensive.

data.definition: to form an idea of the cost, size, value etc. of something, but without calculating it exactly; measure
data.sentence: The satellite will cost an estimated Â£400 million. ;; It is estimated (that) the project will last four years.

data.definition: to make something seem larger, better, worse or more important than it really is
data.sentence: The hotel was really filthy and I'm not exaggerating.

data.definition: a person or thing that is not included in a general statement ; a thing that does not follow a rule ; exclusion
data.sentence: Most of the buildings in the town are modern, but the church is an exception.

data.definition: to give something to somebody and at the same time receive the same type of thing from them ; to sign a contract with the person that you are buying something from, especially a house or land ; switch
data.sentence: Everyone in the group exchanged email addresses.The firm has just exchanged contracts on a nine-acre site

data.definition: extremely good ,outstanding
data.sentence: She speaks excellent French.

data.definition: the state of feeling excited ; thrill
data.sentence: The news caused great excitement among her friends.

data.definition: a collection of things, for example works of art, that are shown to the public display
data.sentence: Have you seen the exhibition of Picasso's paintings?

data.definition: connected with managing a business or an organization, and with making plans and decisions, having the power to put important laws and decisions into effect, expensive; for the use of somebody who is considered important ; decision making
data.sentence: She has an executive position in a finance company.

data.definition: a belief that something will happen because it is likely; a hope that something good will happen; hope
data.sentence: There was a general expectation that he would win.

data.definition: the state of being very tired; the act of using something until it is completely finished ; fatigue
data.sentence: Her face was grey with exhaustion.The exhaustion of natural resources is quite likely at this stage.

data.definition: the sudden violent bursting and loud noise of something such as a bomb exploding; the act of deliberately causing something to explode ; a sudden, violent expression of emotion, especially anger ; blast
data.sentence: There were two loud explosions and then the building burst into flames.Do you know what brought on that explosion?

data.definition: covering a large area; great in amount ; including or dealing with a wide range of information ; broad
data.sentence: The fire caused extensive damage.She has extensive experience in computers.

data.definition: unexpected, surprising or strange ; not normal or ordinary; greater or better than usual ; unusual
data.sentence: The president took the extraordinary step of apologizing publicly for his behaviour!She was a truly extraordinary woman.

data.definition: lack of success in doing or achieving something ; the state of not working correctly or as expected; an occasion when this happens ; not a success
data.sentence: The success or failure of the plan depends on you.Production has been hampered by mechanical failure

data.definition: something that you feel through the mind or through the senses ; the idea or belief that a particular thing is true or a particular situation is likely to happen ; the ability to feel physically ; emotion
data.sentence: I had a nasty feeling that we were lost.I've lost all feeling in my legs

data.definition: having a system of government in which the individual states of a country have control over their own affairs, but are controlled by a central government for national decisions, etc; connected with national government rather than the local government of a
data.sentence: State and federal income taxes are different in USA and Canada.

data.definition: in a strong or definite way
data.sentence: I can manage,â€™ she said firmly.

data.definition: to add something to food or drink to give it more flavour or a particular flavour ; taste
data.sentence: I like to have a chocolate flavour ice cream.

data.definition: the soft substance between the skin and bones of animal or human bodies
data.sentence: Tigers are flesh-eating animals.

data.definition: a journey made by air, especially in a plane ; a journey made by air, especially in a plane
data.sentence: All flights between New York and Washington have been cancelled due to fog.The bird is easily recognized in flight

data.definition: an infectious disease like a very bad cold, that causes fever, pains and weakness
data.sentence: The whole family has the flu.

data.definition: to say what you think will happen in the future based on information that you have now ; predict
data.sentence: It is difficult to forecast the demand for the new train service. Temperatures were forecast to reach 40Â°C.

data.definition: in or from a country that is not your own ; distant
data.sentence: You could tell she was foreign by the way she dressed.

data.definition: a series of letters, numbers or symbols that represent a rule or law ; letters and symbols that show the parts of a chemical compound, etc ; a list of the things that something is made from, giving the amount of each substance to use ; method
data.sentence: This formula is used to calculate the area of a circle.CO is the formula for carbon monoxide.The secret formula for the blending of lassi is not a complex thing.

data.definition: happening or doing something often ; common
data.sentence: He is a frequent visitor to this country.

data.definition: to become hard, and often turn to ice, as a result of extreme cold; to make something do this ; to stop moving suddenly because of fear, etc ; chill
data.sentence: It's so cold in Antarctica that even the rivers freeze.

data.definition: chance or luck, especially in the way it affects people's lives ; a large amount of money ; luck
data.sentence: I have had the good fortune to work with some brilliant directors.He made a fortune in real estate
